values.ctor:
<init>(protocol: String!, host: String!, port: Int, file: String!)
            Creates a URL object from the specified protocol, host, port number, and file.

<init>(protocol: String!, host: String!, file: String!)
            Creates a URL from the specified protocol name, host name, and file name.

<init>(protocol: String!, host: String!, port: Int, file: String!, handler: URLStreamHandler!)
            Creates a URL object from the specified protocol, host, port number, file, and handler.

<init>(spec: String!)
            Creates a URL object from the String representation.

<init>(context: URL!, spec: String!)
            Creates a URL by parsing the given spec within a specified context.

<init>(context: URL!, spec: String!, handler: URLStreamHandler!)
            Creates a URL by parsing the given spec with the specified handler within a specified context.

Returns a URLConnection instance that represents a connection to the remote object referred to by the URL.

Same as openConnection(), except that the connection will be made through the specified proxy; Protocol handlers that do not support proxing will ignore the proxy parameter and make a normal connection.
Opens a connection to this URL and returns an InputStream for reading from that connection.
